item.title: White House Has No Comment on House GOPers' Assertions that Libyan Mission Requested Security Prior to 9/11/12 Attack
item.description: White House Has No Comment on House GOPers' Assertions that Libyan Mission Requested Security Prior to 9/11/12 Attack > http://t.co/TfkwFMQh
item.content:encoded: White House Has No Comment on House GOPers' Assertions that Libyan Mission Requested Security Prior to 9/11/12 Attack > http://t.co/TfkwFMQh White House press secretary Jay Carney declined to comment on an assertion by the chairman of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee that requests from diplomats in Libya for added security prior to the September 11, 2012 attack on the diplomatic post in Benghazi, Libya, were denied. “I’m not going to get into a situation under review by the State Department and the FBI,” Carney said. Earlier today, chairman of the committee Rep. Darrell Issa, R-Calif., and Rep. Jason Chaffetz, R-Utah, the chair of the subcommittee on national security, homeland defense, and foreign operations, wrote to Secretary of State… Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abcnews.go.com

item.title: Lockheed: Sure, we’ll keep our workers in the dark about layoffs - Hot Air
item.description: Lockheed: Sure, we’ll keep our workers in the dark about layoffs: Transparency. To quote Glenn Reynolds, they to... http://t.co/0hIQTiLy
item.content:encoded: Lockheed: Sure, we’ll keep our workers in the dark about layoffs: Transparency. To quote Glenn Reynolds, they to... http://t.co/0hIQTiLy To quote Glenn Reynolds, they told me if I voted for John McCain that the corporations would conspire with the government to keep the working class in the dark — and they were right! Normally, Democrats would demand that companies considering layoffs tell their employees about it. In fact, Democrats passed a law requiring corporations to do so, the WARN Act of 1988, which they passed with veto-proof majorities and which became law without then-President Ronald Reagan’s signature. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: hotair.com

item.title: Sensational Social Media Facts, Figures and Statistics - 6 Infographics | Jeffbullas's Blog
item.description: Sensational Social Media Facts, Figures and Statistics – 6 Infographics: Social media is no longer just abou... http://t.co/AFM9542y #fb
item.content:encoded: Sensational Social Media Facts, Figures and Statistics – 6 Infographics: Social media is no longer just abou... http://t.co/AFM9542y #fb Social media is no longer just about Facebook. Social media is splintering and fragmenting as more users find increased activity about their interests and passions residing on other social networks. Facebook knows that it cannot evolve internally fast enough to keep up with this dispersion and so, Social media is no longer just about Facebook. Social media is splintering and fragmenting as more users find increased activity about their interests and passions residing on other social networks, such as Pinterest, Instagram and Twitter. Here are some facts, figures and statistics to help you keep on top of the social media revolution. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: jeffbullas.com

item.title: U.S. Consulate in Benghazi Bombed Twice In Run-Up to 9/11 Anniversary
item.description: http://t.co/Ilb5rNDe More on our Libya investigation. #Libya @thedailybeast #UTPOL
item.content:encoded: http://t.co/Ilb5rNDe More on our Libya investigation. #Libya @thedailybeast #UTPOL Jihadists twice set off explosives at the consulate prior to the incident that killed Ambassador Chris Stevens, and announced threats on Facebook in escalating attacks on Western targets in the run-up to the 9/11 anniversary, according to whistleblowers reaching out to House Republicans. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thedailybeast.com

item.title: Why We Are So Rude on Facebook and Other Social Media - WSJ.com
item.description: Why We Are So Rude Online http://t.co/1jQNZMfz
item.content:encoded: Why We Are So Rude Online http://t.co/1jQNZMfz Soon-to-be-published research from professors at Columbia University and the University of Pittsburgh links online browsing to lower self control, higher debt and weight. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: wsj.com

item.title: 'More families using food banks'
item.description: #BBC 'More families using food banks' http://t.co/2nbdC2E7 via @Namaku_Marwan
item.content:encoded: #BBC 'More families using food banks' http://t.co/2nbdC2E7 via @Namaku_Marwan Household incomes in Wales fell by an average of £80 per month in a year, statistics show, with a charity saying more people are turning to food banks for help. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: bbc.co.uk
